application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions:
TREE WORKS (COMPLIANCE):  All tree work shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard BS3998 - Recommendations for Tree Work.  In addition: 
a)   No fires shall be lit within [10] metres of the nearest point of the canopy of any retained tree.  No equipment, machinery or structure shall be attached to or supported by a retained tree.
b)   No mixing of cement or use of other contaminating materials or substances shall take place within, or close enough to, a root protection area that seepage or displacement could cause them to enter a root protection area. 
c)   No alterations or variations to the approved works or tree protection schemes shall be made without prior written consent of the local planning authority.

REASON:  In the interest of the protection of trees and to safeguard visual amenities.
description:
CONSERVATION AREA WORKS
T3	English oak: Prune north / west crown branch lengths of 2-2.5m to give clearance. Crown thin 15%	
T12	Apple: Crown reduce height and spread 1-1.5m branch lengths to retain compact form	

TPO WORKS
T1	Sycamore: Crown reduce height 2-2.5m below previous reduction points pruning branch lengths of up to 4.5m -5m to provide more compact shape
Crown reduce spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2-2.5m 	
T2	Cherry: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 1.5-2-2.0m 	
T5	Sycamore: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2.0-2.5m 	
T6	Sycamore: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2.0-2.5m 	
T7	Sycamore: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2.0-2.5m 	
T8	Sycamore: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2.0-2.5m 	
T9	Sycamore: Crown reduce height and spread to previous reduction points pruning branch lengths 2.0-2.5m
